title: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
description: Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a field of artificial intelligence that focuses on the interaction between computers and humans through natural language. It enables machines to understand, interpret, and generate human language.

sections.title: What is NLP?
sections.content: NLP combines computational linguistics with machine learning to process and analyze large amounts of natural language data. It is used in applications like:

items.title: Text Translation
items.description: Translating text from one language to another (e.g., Google Translate).

items.title: Sentiment Analysis
items.description: Determining the emotional tone of text (e.g., positive, negative, neutral).

items.title: Chatbots
items.description: Automating customer service through conversational agents.

items.title: Speech Recognition
items.description: Converting spoken language into text (e.g., Siri, Alexa).

items.title: Tokenization
items.description: Breaking text into smaller units like words or sentences.

items.title: Part-of-Speech Tagging
items.description: Identifying the grammatical parts of words (e.g., noun, verb, adjective).

items.title: Named Entity Recognition (NER)
items.description: Identifying entities like names, dates, or locations.

items.title: Sentiment Analysis
items.description: Determining the emotional tone of text.

sections.title: Applications of NLP
sections.content: NLP is used in various industries and applications:

items.title: Healthcare
items.description: Analyzing medical records and assisting in diagnosis.

items.title: Finance
items.description: Detecting fraud and analyzing market sentiment.

items.title: E-commerce
items.description: Improving search engines and recommendation systems.
